segment.source: Auto configuration and auto proxy problems with Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Auto configuration and auto proxy problems with Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Auto configuration and auto proxy problems with Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Auto configuration and auto proxy problems with Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Auto configuration and auto proxy problems with Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Auto configuration and auto proxy problems with Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: You might experience some problems using automatic configuration and auto-proxy with Internet Explorer 11.
segment.target: You might experience some problems using automatic configuration and auto-proxy with Internet Explorer 11.

segment.source: Branding changes aren't distributed using automatic configuration
segment.target: Branding changes aren't distributed using automatic configuration

segment.source: If you've turned on the Disable external branding of Internet Explorer Group Policy Object, you won't be able to use automatic configuration to distribute your branding changes to your users' computers.
segment.target: If you've turned on the Disable external branding of Internet Explorer Group Policy Object, you won't be able to use automatic configuration to distribute your branding changes to your users' computers.

segment.source: When this object is turned on, it prevents the branding of IE by a non-Microsoft company or entity, such as an Internet service provider or Internet content provider.
segment.target: When this object is turned on, it prevents the branding of IE by a non-Microsoft company or entity, such as an Internet service provider or Internet content provider.

segment.source: For more information about automatic configuration, see Auto configuration settings for Internet Explorer 11 and Use the Automatic Configuration page in the IEAK 11 Wizard.
segment.target: For more information about automatic configuration, see Auto configuration settings for Internet Explorer 11 and Use the Automatic Configuration page in the IEAK 11 Wizard.

segment.source: For more information about Group Policy settings, see Group policy objects and Internet Explorer 11 (IE11).
segment.target: For more information about Group Policy settings, see Group policy objects and Internet Explorer 11 (IE11).

segment.source: Proxy server setup issues
segment.target: Proxy server setup issues

segment.source: If you experience issues while setting up your proxy server, you can try these troubleshooting steps:
segment.target: If you experience issues while setting up your proxy server, you can try these troubleshooting steps:

segment.source: Check to make sure the proxy server address is right.
segment.target: Check to make sure the proxy server address is right.

segment.source: Check that both Automatically detect settings and Automatic configuration are turned on in the browser.
segment.target: Check that both Automatically detect settings and Automatic configuration are turned on in the browser.

segment.source: Check that the browser is pointing to the right automatic configuration script location.
segment.target: Check that the browser is pointing to the right automatic configuration script location.

segment.source: To check your proxy server address
segment.target: To check your proxy server address

segment.source: On the Tools menu, click Internet Options, and then Connections.
segment.target: On the Tools menu, click Internet Options, and then Connections.

segment.source: Click Settings or LAN Settings, and then look at your proxy server address.
segment.target: Click Settings or LAN Settings, and then look at your proxy server address.

segment.source: If you have multiple proxy servers, click Advanced to look at all of the additional addresses.
segment.target: If you have multiple proxy servers, click Advanced to look at all of the additional addresses.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If IE11 uses a proxy server for local IP addresses, regardless whether you turned on the Bypass Proxy Server for Local Addresses option, see Internet Explorer Uses Proxy Server for Local IP Address Even if the "Bypass Proxy Server for Local Addresses" Option Is Turned On.
segment.target: If IE11 uses a proxy server for local IP addresses, regardless whether you turned on the Bypass Proxy Server for Local Addresses option, see Internet Explorer Uses Proxy Server for Local IP Address Even if the "Bypass Proxy Server for Local Addresses" Option Is Turned On.

segment.source: To check that you've turned on the correct settings
segment.target: To check that you've turned on the correct settings

segment.source: On the Tools menu, click Internet Options, and then click Connections.
segment.target: On the Tools menu, click Internet Options, and then click Connections.

segment.source: Click Settings or LAN Settings.
segment.target: Click Settings or LAN Settings.

segment.source: In the Automatic configuration area, check that you've clicked the Automatically detect settings box.
segment.target: In the Automatic configuration area, check that you've clicked the Automatically detect settings box.

segment.source: If you've turned on automatic configuration, check to make sure that you've also clicked the Use automatic configuration script box.
segment.target: If you've turned on automatic configuration, check to make sure that you've also clicked the Use automatic configuration script box.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If at this point everything is set up correctly, but the proxy server still isn't behaving properly, click the Detect my network settings box in the Error dialog box to try to detect the proxy server, again.
segment.target: If at this point everything is set up correctly, but the proxy server still isn't behaving properly, click the Detect my network settings box in the Error dialog box to try to detect the proxy server, again.

segment.source: To check that you're pointing to the correct automatic configuration script location
segment.target: To check that you're pointing to the correct automatic configuration script location

segment.source: On the Tools menu, click Internet Options, and then click Connections.
segment.target: On the Tools menu, click Internet Options, and then click Connections.

segment.source: Click Settings or LAN Settings.
segment.target: Click Settings or LAN Settings.

segment.source: In the Automatic configuration area, check that you've chosen the Use automatic configuration script box, and that it has the correct location to your automatic configuration script or for your automatic proxy URL.
segment.target: In the Automatic configuration area, check that you've chosen the Use automatic configuration script box, and that it has the correct location to your automatic configuration script or for your automatic proxy URL.
